cli progress bar benchmark

Gábor Csárdi

2021-07-01

Source: vignettes/progress-benchmark.Rmd
progress-benchmark.Rmd

Introduction

We make sure that the timer is not TRUE, by setting it to ten hours.

library(cli)
# 10 hours
cli:::cli_tick_set(10 * 60 * 60 * 1000)
cli_tick_reset()
#> NULL
`__cli_update_due`
#> [1] FALSE

R benchmarks

The timer

fun <- function() NULL
ben_st <- bench::mark(
  `__cli_update_due`,
  fun(),
  .Call(ccli_tick_reset),
  interactive(),
  check = FALSE
)
ben_st
#> # A tibble: 4 x 6
#>   expression                  min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr>             <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 __cli_update_due           28ns     35ns 23897261.        0B        0
#> 2 fun()                     161ns    201ns  3256039.        0B        0
#> 3 .Call(ccli_tick_reset)    126ns    142ns  6006796.        0B        0
#> 4 interactive()              26ns     29ns 30631717.        0B        0
ben_st2 <- bench::mark(
  if (`__cli_update_due`) foobar()
)
ben_st2
#> # A tibble: 1 x 6
#>   expression                            min  median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr>                       <bch:tm> <bch:t>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 if (`__cli_update_due`) foobar()     72ns    82ns 10908278.        0B        0

cli_progress_along() 

seq <- 1:100000
ta <- cli_progress_along(seq)
bench::mark(seq[[1]], ta[[1]])
#> # A tibble: 2 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 seq[[1]]      139ns    182ns  4707854.        0B        0
#> 2 ta[[1]]       148ns    192ns  4065008.        0B        0

for loop

This is the baseline:

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  x <- 0
  seq <- 1:n
  for (i in seq) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
  }
  x
}

With progress bars:

fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  x <- 0
  seq <- 1:n
  for (i in cli_progress_along(seq)) {
    x <- x + seq[[i]] %% 2
  }
  x
}

Overhead per iteration:

ben_taf <- bench::mark(f0(), fp())
ben_taf
#> # A tibble: 2 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 f0()           15ms   15.1ms      65.3    96.8KB     522.
#> 2 fp()         17.1ms   17.7ms      56.5   181.9KB     414.
(ben_taf$median[2] - ben_taf$median[1]) / 1e5
#> [1] 25.7ns
ben_taf2 <- bench::mark(f0(1e6), fp(1e6))

Mapping with lapply

This is the baseline:

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- lapply(seq, function(x) {
    x %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With an index vector:

f01 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- lapply(seq_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With progress bars:

fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- lapply(cli_progress_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

Overhead per iteration:

ben_tam <- bench::mark(f0(), f01(), fp())
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_tam
#> # A tibble: 3 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 f0()           74ms   87.1ms     10.9      781KB     20.0
#> 2 f01()         108ms  122.4ms      8.00     781KB     14.4
#> 3 fp()          122ms  124.9ms      7.49     782KB     16.8
(ben_tam$median[3] - ben_tam$median[1]) / 1e5
#> [1] 378ns
ben_tam2 <- bench::mark(f0(1e6), f01(1e6), fp(1e6))
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_tam2
#> # A tibble: 3 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`

#> 1 f0(1e+06)   798.2ms  798.2ms     1.25     7.63MB     5.01
#> 2 f01(1e+06)    1.27s    1.27s     0.787    7.63MB     5.51
#> 3 fp(1e+06)     1.71s    1.71s     0.586    7.63MB     4.11
(ben_tam2$median[3] - ben_tam2$median[1]) / 1e6
#> [1] 907ns
(ben_tam2$median[3] - ben_tam2$median[2]) / 1e6
#> [1] 434ns

Mapping with purrr

This is the baseline:

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- purrr::map(seq, function(x) {
    x %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With index vector:

f01 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- purrr::map(seq_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

With progress bars:

fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  seq <- 1:n
  ret <- purrr::map(cli_progress_along(seq), function(i) {
    seq[[i]] %% 2
  })
  invisible(ret)
}

Overhead per iteration:

(ben_pur2$median[3] - ben_pur2$median[2]) / 1e6
#> [1] 369ns

ticking() 

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  i <- 0
  x <- 0 
  while (i < n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    i <- i + 1
  }
  x
}
fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  i <- 0
  x <- 0 
  while (ticking(i < n)) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    i <- i + 1
  }
  x
}
ben_tk <- bench::mark(f0(), fp())
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_tk
#> # A tibble: 2 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 f0()        14.38ms   14.5ms    66.5      41.3KB     3.91
#> 2 fp()          4.45s    4.45s     0.225     158KB     2.02
(ben_tk$median[2] - ben_tk$median[1]) / 1e5
#> [1] 44.4µs

Traditional API

f0 <- function(n = 1e5) {
  x <- 0
  for (i in 1:n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
  }
  x
}
fp <- function(n = 1e5) {
  cli_progress_bar(total = n)
  x <- 0
  for (i in 1:n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    cli_progress_update()
  }
  x
}
ff <- function(n = 1e5) {
  cli_progress_bar(total = n)
  x <- 0
  for (i in 1:n) {
    x <- x + i %% 2
    if (`__cli_update_due`) cli_progress_update()
  }
  x
}
ben_api <- bench::mark(f0(), ff(), fp())
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_api
#> # A tibble: 3 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 f0()         13.3ms   13.5ms    65.2      19.9KB     5.93
#> 2 ff()         19.5ms   19.7ms    45.4      27.9KB     3.95
#> 3 fp()           2.5s     2.5s     0.399    25.3KB     2.00
(ben_api$median[3] - ben_api$median[1]) / 1e5
#> [1] 24.9µs
(ben_api$median[2] - ben_api$median[1]) / 1e5
#> [1] 61.5ns
ben_api2 <- bench::mark(f0(1e6), ff(1e6), fp(1e6))
#> Warning: Some expressions had a GC in every iteration; so filtering is disabled.
ben_api2
#> # A tibble: 3 x 6
#>   expression      min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr> <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 f0(1e+06)   297.3ms  359.5ms    2.78          0B     2.78
#> 2 ff(1e+06)   861.7ms  861.7ms    1.16      1.16KB     1.16
#> 3 fp(1e+06)     30.4s    30.4s    0.0329    1.16KB     1.55
(ben_api2$median[3] - ben_api2$median[1]) / 1e6
#> [1] 30µs
(ben_api2$median[2] - ben_api2$median[1]) / 1e6
#> [1] 502ns

C benchmarks

Baseline function:

SEXP test_baseline() {
  int i;
  int res = 0;
  for (i = 0; i < 2000000000; i++) {
    res += i % 2;
  }
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}

Switch + modulo check:

SEXP test_modulo(SEXP progress) {
  int i;
  int res = 0;
  int progress_ = LOGICAL(progress)[0];
  for (i = 0; i < 2000000000; i++) {
    if (i % 10000 == 0 && progress_) cli_progress_set(R_NilValue, i);
    res += i % 2;
  }
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}

cli progress bar API:

SEXP test_cli() {
  int i;
  int res = 0;
  SEXP bar = PROTECT(cli_progress_bar(2000000000, NULL));
  for (i = 0; i < 2000000000; i++) {
    if (CLI_SHOULD_TICK) cli_progress_set(bar, i);
    res += i % 2;
  }
  cli_progress_done(bar);
  UNPROTECT(1);
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}
SEXP test_cli_unroll() {
  int i = 0;
  int res = 0;
  SEXP bar = PROTECT(cli_progress_bar(2000000000, NULL));
  int s, final, step = 2000000000 / 100000;
  for (s = 0; s < 100000; s++) {
    if (CLI_SHOULD_TICK) cli_progress_set(bar, i);
    final = (s + 1) * step;
    for (i = s * step; i < final; i++) {
      res += i % 2;
    }
  }
  cli_progress_done(bar);
  UNPROTECT(1);
  return ScalarInteger(res);
}
library(progresstest)
ben_c <- bench::mark(
  test_baseline(),
  test_modulo(),
  test_cli(),
  test_cli_unroll()
)
ben_c
#> # A tibble: 4 x 6
#>   expression             min   median `itr/sec` mem_alloc `gc/sec`
#>   <bch:expr>        <bch:tm> <bch:tm>     <dbl> <bch:byt>    <dbl>
#> 1 test_baseline()   104.73ms 105.27ms     9.45     9.23KB        0
#> 2 test_modulo()        1.22s    1.22s     0.820    3.86KB        0
#> 3 test_cli()           1.13s    1.13s     0.884   38.59KB        0
#> 4 test_cli_unroll() 101.32ms 104.67ms     9.64     5.46KB        0
(ben_c$median[3] - ben_c$median[1]) / 2000000000
#> [1] 1ns

Display update

We only update the display a fixed number of times per second. (Currently maximum five times per second.)

Let’s measure how long a single update takes.

Iterator with a bar

cli_progress_bar(total = 100000)
bench::mark(cli_progress_update(force = TRUE), max_iterations = 10000)
#> ■                                  0% | ETA:  6m
#> ■                                  0% | ETA:  3h
#> ■                                  0% | ETA:  2h
